docs.snippet: Japanese government officials are bracing for Donald Trump to get tough in trade talks, and are particularly anxious that the U.S. president could target Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's weak-yen policies.

headline.main: Japan Braces for Trump Assault on Trade, Yen Policy as Summit Looms
headline.print_headline: Japan Braces for Trump Assault on Trade, Yen Policy as Summit Looms

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump is pointing to a 50 percent job approval rating that may not fully comport with reality.

headline.main: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Cites Questionable Job Approval Rating
headline.print_headline: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Cites Questionable Job Approval Rating

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump's personal lawyer asked a federal judge on Monday to force adult film star Stormy Daniels to use arbitration to settle a dispute over an agreement to keep quiet about a sexual encounter she says she had with Trump.

headline.main: Trump Attorney Seeks to Force Porn Star's Lawsuit Into Arbitration
headline.print_headline: Trump Attorney Seeks to Force Porn Star's Lawsuit Into Arbitration

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday he would take a very serious look at policies that might affect online retailer Amazon.com Inc.

headline.main: Trump Says Taking a Serious Look at Policy Options on Amazon
headline.print_headline: Trump Says Taking a Serious Look at Policy Options on Amazon

docs.snippet: Oil prices fell on Friday along with equities as U.S. President Trump's threat of new tariffs on China reignited fears of a trade war between the world's two biggest economies.

headline.main: Oil Falls After U.S. President Trump Threatens New China Tariffs
headline.print_headline: Oil Falls After U.S. President Trump Threatens New China Tariffs

docs.snippet: Mexico's Senate issued a stern rebuke to U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday, urging its government to end cooperation with the United States on migration and security over Trump's plans to deploy the National Guard along their shared border.

headline.main: Mexico Senate Rebukes Trump Over Border Deployment Plans
headline.print_headline: Mexico Senate Rebukes Trump Over Border Deployment Plans

docs.snippet: The Trump administration says it is amenable to a White House meeting between President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin, raising the prospect of the Russian president's first Washington visit in more than a decade even as relatio...

headline.main: US Raises Prospect of Trump-Putin Meeting at the White House
headline.print_headline: US Raises Prospect of Trump-Putin Meeting at the White House

docs.snippet: Gary Bailey is certain China is trying to rattle Donald Trump voters with its threat to slap tariffs on soybeans and other agriculture staples grown in rural America. The wheat farmer in eastern Washington, a state that exports $4 billion a year i...

headline.main: Trump Trade Moves Rattle Republican Voters in Rural America
headline.print_headline: Trump Trade Moves Rattle Republican Voters in Rural America

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump will review a list of potential changes to the nation's renewable fuel laws at a meeting with members of his cabinet on Monday, two sources said, as biofuels groups warned against any action that would weaken ethanol de...

headline.main: Trump to Mull U.S. Biofuels Policy Options in Cabinet Meeting Monday
headline.print_headline: Trump to Mull U.S. Biofuels Policy Options in Cabinet Meeting Monday

docs.snippet: Qatar's Emir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad al-Thani will meet U.S. President Donald Trump on April 10 in Washington, the state news agency QNA reported on late Thursday.

headline.main: Qatar Emir to Meet Trump on April 10-Qatar News Agency
headline.print_headline: Qatar Emir to Meet Trump on April 10-Qatar News Agency
